gurmukhi: ਓਰੜੲੇ ਹੰਕਾਰੀ ਧੱਗਾਂ ਵਾੲਿਕੈ ॥ ਵਾਹਿ ਫਿਰੇ ਤਰਵਾਰੀ ਸੂਰੇ ਸੂਰਿਅਾਂ ॥
transliteration: Oradae Hankaaridhaggadn Vaaekai|| Vaah(i) Phire Tarvaarisoore Sooriaan||
translation: The proud warriors marched forward after causing the resonance of big trumpets and began to strike blows with their swords.

gurmukhi: ਵੱਗੇ ਰਤੁ ਝੁਲਾਰੀ ਝਾੜੀ ਕੈਬਰੀ ॥ ਪਾੲੀ ਧੂੰਮ ਲੁਝਾਰੀ ਰਾਵਣ ਰਾਮ ਦੀ ॥੪੬੯॥
transliteration: Vagge Rat(u) Jhulaarijhadikaidaree|| Paaidhoonm Lujhaariraavan Raam Dee||469||
translation: With the shower of arrows a continuous stream of blood flowed and this war of Ram and Ravana became famours on all the four sides.469.

gurmukhi: ਚੋਬੀ ਧੳੁਸ ਵਜਾੲੀ ਸੰਘੁਰ ਮੱਚਿਅਾ ॥ ਬਾਹਿ ਫਿਰੈ ਵੈਰਾੲੀ ਤੁਰੇ ਤਤਾਰਚੇ ॥
transliteration: Chobidhaous Vajaaisanhur Machchiaa|| Baah(i) Phirai Vairaaiture Tataarche||
translation: With the sounding of trumpets a terrible war began and the enemies wandered here and there on the fast-moving steeds;

gurmukhi: ਹੂਰਾਂ ਚਿੱਤ ਵਧਾੲੀ ਅੰਬਰ ਪੂਰਿਅਾ ॥ ਜੋਧਿਯਾਂ ਦੇਖਣ ਤਾੲੀ ਹੂਲੇ ਹੋੲੀਅਾਂ ॥੪੭੦॥
transliteration: Hooraan Chitt Vadhaaianbar Pooreeaa|| Jodhiyaan Dekhaan Dekhan Taaihoole Hoeeaan||470||
translation: There on the sky the heavenly damsels gathered together with the zeal of wedding the brave warriors and came nearer in order to see them waging the war.470.

gurmukhi: ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰਾਰ ਵੀਰ ਕੁੱਪਯੋ ਕਰਾਲ ॥ ਮੁਕਤੰਤ ਬਾਣ ਗਹਿ ਧਨੁ ਬਿਸਾਲ ॥
transliteration: Indraar Veer Kouppyo Karaal|| Mouktant Baan Gad(i) Dhan(u) Bidaal||
translation: Inderjit in great fury, holding his wide bow, began to discharge arrows;

gurmukhi: ਥਰਕੰਤ ਲੁੱਥ ਫਰਕੰਤ ਬਾਹ ॥ ਜੁੱਝੰਤ ਸੂਰ ਅੱਛਰੈ ੳੁਛਾਹ ॥੪੭੧॥
transliteration: Tharkant Loutth Pharkant Baah|| Jujjhant Soor Achchhrai Ouchhaad||471||
translation: The corpses writhed and the arms of the warriors fluttered; the warriors began to fight and the heavenly damsels were filled with joy.471.

gurmukhi: ਚਮਕੰਤ ਚੱਕ੍ਰ ਸਰਖੰਤ ਸੇਲ ॥ ਜੁੱਮੇ ਜਟਾਲ ਜਣ ਗੰਗ ਮੇਲ ॥
transliteration: Chamkant Chakkra Sarkhanndsel|| Joumme Jataal Jaan Gadg Mel||
translation: The discs glittered, the lances moved and the fighters with matted hair sped up to fight as if they are going to take a bath in the Ganges.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਘਰੇ ਸੂਰ ਅਾਘਾੲਿ ਘਾੲਿ ॥ ਬਰਖੰਤ ਬਾਣ ਚੜ ਚੳੁਪ ਚਾੲਿ ॥੪੭੨॥
transliteration: Sandare Soor Aaghaae Ghaae|| Barkhaant Baan Chad Chaoup Chaae||472||
translation: The wounded warriors were killed and on the other hand the warriors began to shower arrows with fourfold zeal.472.

gurmukhi: ਸੱਮੁਲੇ ਸੂਰ ਅਾਹੁਰੇ ਜੰਗ ॥ ਬਰਖੰਤ ਬਾਣ ਬਿਖ ਧਰ ਸੁਰੰਗ ॥
transliteration: Sammule Soor Aahure Jan|| Barkhanndbaan Bikh Dhar Suran||
translation: The frightful warriors entangled in war are showering arrows like poisonous serpents;

gurmukhi: ਨਭਿ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਅਲੋਪ ਸਰ ਬਰਖ ਧਾਰ ॥ ਸਭ ੳੂਚ ਨੀਚ ਕਿੰਨੇ ਸੁਮਾਰ ॥੪੭੩॥
transliteration: Nabh(i) Hvai Alop Sar Barakh Dhaar|| Sabh Ooch Naach Kinne Soumaar||473||
translation: With the shower of arrows the sky is not visible and there in no differentiation between high and low.473.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਬਿੱਦਿਅਾ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਨ ॥ ਸਰ ਧਾਰ ਬਰਖ ਸਰਦਾਰ ਚੀਨ ॥
transliteration: Sabh Sastra Astra Biddiaa Prabeen|| Sar Dhaar Barakh Sardaar Cheen||
translation: All the warriors specialize in the science of weaponry and locating the general they are showering arrows on them;

gurmukhi: ਰਘੁਰਾਜ ਅਾਦਿ ਮੋਹੇ ਸੁ ਬੀਰ ॥ ਦਲ ਸਹਿਤ ਭੂਮ ਡਿੱਗੇ ਅਧੀਰ ॥੪੭੪॥
transliteration: Raghuraaj Aadh Mohe Su Beer|| Dal Sahit Bhoom Digge Adheer||474||
translation: Even Ram, the king of Raghu clan was beguiled and fell on the earth alongwith his army.474.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਕਹੀ ਦੂਤ ਰਾਵਣਹਿ ਜਾੲਿ ॥ ਕਪਿ ਕਟਕ ਅਾਜੁ ਜੀਤਯੋ ਬਨਾੲਿ ॥
transliteration: Tab Kahidoot Raavanah(i) Jaae|| Kap(i) Katak Aad(u) Jeetyo Banaae||
translation: Then the messengers went to give the news to Ravana that the forces of monkeys have been defeated;
